verses.verse: Open <S%H6605><s%> thy doors <S%H1817><s%>, O Lebanon <S%H3844><s%>, that the fire <S%H784><s%> may devour <S%H398><s%> thy cedars <S%H730><s%>.

Wail <S%H3213><s%>, O fir-tree <S%H1265><s%>, for the cedar <S%H730><s%> is fallen <S%H5307><s%>, because the goodly <S%H117><s%> ones are destroyed <S%H7703><s%>: wail <S%H3213><s%>, O ye oaks <S%H437><s%> of Bashan <S%H1316><s%>, for the strong <S%H1208><s%> forest <S%H3293><s%> is come down <S%H3381><s%>.

A voice <S%H6963><s%> of the wailing <S%H3215><s%> of the shepherds <S%H7462><s%>! for their glory <S%H155><s%> is destroyed <S%H7703><s%>: a voice <S%H6963><s%> of the roaring <S%H7581><s%> of young lions <S%H3715><s%>! for the pride <S%H1347><s%> of the Jordan <S%H3383><s%> is laid waste <S%H7703><s%>.
Thus said <S%H559><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> my God <S%H430><s%>: Feed <S%H7462><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%> of slaughter <S%H2028><s%>;

whose possessors <S%H7069><s%> slay <S%H2026><s%> them <S%H816><s%>, and hold themselves not guilty; and they that sell <S%H4376><s%> them say <S%H559><s%>, Blessed <S%H1288><s%> be Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, for I am rich <S%H6238><s%>; and their own shepherds <S%H7462><s%> pity them not <S%H2550><s%>.

For I will no more pity <S%H2550><s%> the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%>, saith <S%H5002><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>; but <S%H4672><s%>, lo, I will deliver the men <S%H120><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> into his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>'s hand <S%H3027><s%>, and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of his king <S%H4428><s%>; and they shall smite <S%H3807><s%> the land <S%H776><s%>, and out of their hand <S%H3027><s%> I will not deliver them <S%H5337><s%>.

So I fed <S%H7462><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%> of slaughter <S%H2028><s%>, verily <S%H3651><s%> the poor <S%H6041><s%> of the flock <S%H6629><s%>. And I took <S%H3947><s%> unto me two <S%H8147><s%> staves <S%H4731><s%>; the one <S%H259><s%> I called <S%H7121><s%> Beauty <S%H5278><s%>, and the other <S%H259><s%> I called <S%H7121><s%> Bands <S%H2254><s%>; and I fed <S%H7462><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%>.

And I cut off <S%H3582><s%> the three <S%H7969><s%> shepherds <S%H7462><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> month <S%H3391><s%>; for my soul <S%H5315><s%> was weary <S%H7114><s%> of them <S%H5315><s%>, and their soul also loathed me <S%H973><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> I <S%H7462><s%>, I will not feed you <S%H4191><s%>: that which dieth, let it die <S%H4191><s%>; and that which is to be cut off <S%H3582><s%>, let it be cut off <S%H3582><s%>; and let them that are left <S%H7604><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> every one <S%H802><s%> the flesh <S%H1320><s%> of another <S%H7468><s%>.

And I took <S%H3947><s%> my staff <S%H4731><s%> Beauty <S%H5278><s%>, and cut it asunder <S%H1438><s%>, that I might break <S%H6565><s%> my covenant <S%H1285><s%> which I had made <S%H3772><s%> with all the peoples <S%H5971><s%>.

And it was broken <S%H6565><s%> in that day <S%H3117><s%>; and thus the poor <S%H6041><s%> of the flock <S%H6629><s%> that gave heed <S%H8104><s%> unto me knew <S%H3045><s%> that it was the word <S%H1697><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

And I said <S%H559><s%> unto them <S%H5869><s%>, If ye think good <S%H2896><s%>, give <S%H3051><s%> me my hire <S%H7939><s%>; and if not <S%H2308><s%>, forbear. So they weighed <S%H8254><s%> for my hire thirty <S%H7970><s%> pieces of silver <S%H3701><s%>.

And Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H7993><s%>, Cast it unto the potter <S%H3335><s%>, the goodly <S%H145><s%> price <S%H3366><s%> that I was prized at <S%H3365><s%> by them <S%H3947><s%>. And I took the thirty <S%H7970><s%> pieces of silver <S%H3701><s%>, and cast <S%H7993><s%> them unto the potter <S%H3335><s%>, in the house <S%H1004><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>.

Then I cut asunder <S%H1438><s%> mine other <S%H8145><s%> staff <S%H4731><s%>, even Bands <S%H2254><s%>, that I might break <S%H6565><s%> the brotherhood <S%H264><s%> between Judah <S%H3063><s%> and Israel <S%H3478><s%>.
And Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto me <S%H3947><s%>, Take unto thee yet again the instruments <S%H3627><s%> of a foolish <S%H196><s%> shepherd <S%H7462><s%>.

For <S%H6965><s%>, lo, I will raise up a shepherd <S%H7462><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%>, who will not visit <S%H6485><s%> those that are cut off <S%H3582><s%>, neither will seek <S%H1245><s%> those that are scattered <S%H5289><s%>, nor heal <S%H7495><s%> that which is broken <S%H7665><s%>, nor feed <S%H3557><s%> that which is sound <S%H5324><s%>; but he will eat <S%H398><s%> the flesh <S%H1320><s%> of the fat <S%H1277><s%> sheep <S%H6561><s%>, and will tear their hoofs <S%H6541><s%> in pieces <S%H6561><s%>.

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to the worthless <S%H457><s%> shepherd <S%H7473><s%> that leaveth <S%H5800><s%> the flock <S%H6629><s%>! the sword <S%H2719><s%> shall be upon his arm <S%H2220><s%>, and upon his right <S%H3225><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%>: his arm <S%H2220><s%> shall be clean <S%H3001><s%> dried up <S%H3001><s%>, and his right <S%H3225><s%> eye <S%H5869><s%> shall be utterly <S%H3543><s%> darkened <S%H3543><s%>.
